misdeed: Livestock have been found slain in the fields. Their carcasses are mangled and partially devoured, bearing strange burn marks and a corrosive odor.
solution: The Vaesen is a Lindworm and can be slain by tricking it into slithering through three separate bonfires.

clues.description: Witnesses describe seeing a massive serpent-like creature with shimmering scales and a white mane, its eyes burning with malevolent intelligence.
The ground near the slain animals is scorched and barren, as if burned by acid.
Local legends speak of a dragon-like creature that dwells in the surrounding hills, hoarding treasure and demanding tribute.
A single, shimmering scale, larger than a man's hand, is found near the site of the latest attack.
The tracks left behind are unlike those of any known animal, suggesting a creature that moves by rolling or slithering.
The air itself feels heavy and oppressive, as if a powerful presence watches from the shadows.

plotTwist.description: A reclusive alchemist has formed a pact with the Vaesen, offering it sacrifices in exchange for its venomous saliva, which he uses in his experiments.
